name: ObservablePoint
description: Observer used to listen for observable point changes. Provides callback mechanism for point value updates. ```ts // Basic observer implementation const observer: Observer<ObservablePoint> = { _onUpdate: (point) => { console.log(`Point updated to (${point.x}, ${point.y})`); } }; // Create observable point with observer const point = new ObservablePoint(observer, 100, 100); // Observer will be notified on changes point.x = 200; // Logs: Point updated to (200, 100) ``` - Used internally by ObservablePoint - Triggered on x/y changes - Can track multiple points - Useful for change detection / export interface Observer<T> { /** Callback to call when the point has updated. Triggered whenever x or y coordinates change. / _onUpdate: (point?: T) => void; } /** The ObservablePoint object represents a location in a two-dimensional coordinate system. Triggers a callback when its position changes. The x and y properties represent the position on the horizontal and vertical axes, respectively. ```ts // Basic observable point usage const point = new ObservablePoint( { _onUpdate: (p) => console.log(`Updated to (${p.x}, ${p.y})`) }, 100, 100 ); // Update triggers callback point.x = 200; // Logs: Updated to (200, 100) point.y = 300; // Logs: Updated to (200, 300) // Set both coordinates point.set(50, 50); // Logs: Updated to (50, 50) ```

methods.name: clone
methods.description: Creates a clone of this point. ```ts // Basic cloning const point = new ObservablePoint(observer, 100, 200); const copy = point.clone(); // Clone with new observer const newObserver = { _onUpdate: (p) => console.log(`Clone updated: (${p.x}, ${p.y})`) }; const watched = point.clone(newObserver); // Verify independence watched.set(300, 400); // Only triggers new observer ```

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets the point to a new x and y position. If y is omitted, both x and y will be set to x. ```ts // Basic position setting const point = new ObservablePoint(observer); point.set(100, 200); // Set both x and y to same value point.set(50); // x=50, y=50 ```

methods.name: copyFrom
methods.description: Copies x and y from the given point into this point. ```ts // Basic copying const source = new ObservablePoint(observer, 100, 200); const target = new ObservablePoint(); target.copyFrom(source); // Copy and chain operations const point = new ObservablePoint() .copyFrom(source) .set(x + 50, y + 50); // Copy from any PointData const data = { x: 10, y: 20 }; point.copyFrom(data); ```

methods.name: equals
methods.description: Copies this point's x and y into the given point. ```ts // Basic copying const source = new ObservablePoint(100, 200); const target = new ObservablePoint(); source.copyTo(target); ``` / public copyTo<T extends PointLike>(p: T): T { p.set(this._x, this._y); return p; } /** Checks if another point is equal to this point. Compares x and y values using strict equality. ```ts // Basic equality check const p1 = new ObservablePoint(100, 200); const p2 = new ObservablePoint(100, 200); console.log(p1.equals(p2)); // true // Compare with PointData const data = { x: 100, y: 200 }; console.log(p1.equals(data)); // true // Check different points const p3 = new ObservablePoint(200, 300); console.log(p1.equals(p3)); // false ```

properties.name: x
properties.description: Position of the observable point on the x axis. Triggers observer callback when value changes. ```ts // Basic x position const point = new ObservablePoint(observer); point.x = 100; // Triggers observer // Use in calculations const width = rightPoint.x - leftPoint.x; ```

properties.name: y
properties.description: Position of the observable point on the y axis. Triggers observer callback when value changes. ```ts // Basic y position const point = new ObservablePoint(observer); point.y = 200; // Triggers observer // Use in calculations const height = bottomPoint.y - topPoint.y; ```
